intro: Galium aragonesii, commonly known as the Aragon bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium aragonesii is often found in limestone-rich soils and is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
